title: WATCH LIVE: Angelo Agrizzi still in the hot seat at the state capture inquiry
text:
WATCH LIVE: Angelo Agrizzi still in the hot seat at the state capture inquiry

29 March, 09:41 AM

Former Bosasa chief operating officer turned whistleblower, Angelo Agrizzi, continued his testimony at the Zondo commission of inquiry on Friday.

Agrizzi on Thursday reiterated allegations that Minister of Environmental Affairs, Nomvula Mokonyane received R50 000 a month in cash from Bosasa.

It was the second time he implicated Mokonyane.

Mokonyane has since said she wants to clear her name at the commission and challenge the damning allegations levelled against her by Agrizzi.



Agrizzi also told the commission that R2.2m was paid by the facilities management company towards former correctional services boss Patrick Gillingham's divorce settlement.



He said CEO Gavin Watson told him to take care of Gillingham's wife because "hell hath no fury like a woman scorned".

Live stream courtesy of SABCnews.com
description: Former Bosasa chief operating officer turned whistleblower, Angelo Agrizzi, will continue his testimony at the Zondo commission of inquiry on Friday.
